## defMutator() function

Higher-order function, similar to . Returns a function, which when called, mutates given object/array at given path location.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function defMutator<T>(path: Path0): Fn2<T, T, T>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  path | <code>Path0</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Fn2<T, T, T>`

## Remarks

The returned function bails if any intermediate path values are non-indexable (only the very last path element can be missing in the actual object structure). If successful, returns original (mutated) object, else `undefined`<!-- -->. This function provides optimized versions for path lengths &lt;<!-- -->= 4.

Only the first 8 path levels are type checked.

Also see [defMutatorUnsafe](./paths.defmutatorunsafe.md)<!-- -->,
